</font><font color="#00FFFF">South Temple Street
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The newly renovated Temple Street is wide and clean, with light colored
bricks gleaming from being freshly washed.  Nobles, common folk and adventurers
alike move about in a steady stream as they make their way through town.  The
Market Square to the south is a common destination, which locals consider to be
the heart of the city.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Temple Hall of Clerics
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The smooth slightly curved walls arches upwards where all four corners meet
at a point in the ceiling.  On one wall is a stained glass mural depicting a
magnificent battle scene, and on another wall is a relief of a large white rose
chiseled in plaster.  Lighting from torches illuminate the room, and a small
area with some candles has been set aside for a prayer bench.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Grunting Boar Inn
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Should you tire of adventure or seek a peaceful nights rest, the Grunting
Boar Inn is willing to accommodate any traveler that carry enough gold.  The
dimly lit foyer has a slight musty odor, possibly coming from various trophy
animals mounted high above the walls.  A cozy arrangement of overstuffed couches
sit next to a blazing fire offering an inviting place to rest.  A simple set of
stairs leads upwards to the Reception Desk, while to the east can be heard the
sounds of bar patrons enjoying fine drink and good company.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">look bartender
Hagan the bartender is a tough looking fellow, squat and powerfully built.  He
bears a deep scar below his right eye, and is missing the tip of his left ring
finger.  His worn and leathery face features a neatly trimmed mustache, but you
are drawn to the p sparkling eyes that sparkle with mischief.  Hagan looks like
he's seen his share of glory in the battlefield, and might be as comfortable
swinging a battle axe as he is a pouring drinks.  
The Bartender appears to be a male Gnome.
The Bartender is in excellent condition.

dimly lit foyer has a slight musty odor, possibly coming from various trophy
animals mounted high above the walls.  A cozy arrangement of overstuffed couches
sit next to a blazing fire offering an inviting place to rest.  A simple set of
stairs leads upwards to the Reception Desk, while to the east can be heard the
sounds of bar patrons enjoying fine drink and good company.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Grunting Boar Tavern
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The rustic old Grunting Boar Tavern has been in business since Midgaard was
recounted by seasoned adventurers, and get a decent drink or two.  An occasional
rowdy patron may at times create an uproar, but generally most are there to
relax and have a good time.  Founded.  It's a well known destination to learn
the local gossip, hear tales recounted by seasoned adventurers, and get a decent
drink or two.  An occasional rowdy patron may at times create an uproar, but
generally most are there to relax and have a good time.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Reception Desk
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing in a reception area.  A hallway leads to the east where
one can rent a room if they need to take a rest from the rigors of a life of
adventuring.  The hallway is closed off by a small steel gate that is 
periodically opened for adventurers wishing a rest.  Next to the hall is a
small counter with a sign sitting on it.
   A fireplace with a cozy little fire is set in the northern wall offering
heat as well as light. The stairs leading up to the third floor will take
you to the extended stay area of the inn.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Grunting Boar Lounge
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   A small foyer furnished with rustic tables and chairs awaits weary travelers
wishing to take a break from their adventures.  Landscape paintings of the
surrounding forests and countryside cover the walls, making for a peaceful and
cozy atmosphere to lounge for a while and rest.  The stairs leading down will
take you to the second floor of the inn, while the extended stay rooms can be
found just to the north.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Extended Stay Reception Area
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The reception area here is complete with a large cocobolo desk, a service
bell, and a staff of workers tending to the needs of the many residents it
houses.  Hallways lead off to the north, east, and west from here where many
chamber doors can be seen by the marked addition of lit sconces on the walls.  
Off to the south you can make out the inn's lounge room.  A large sign hangs
directly above the reception desk.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Reception Desk
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing in a reception area.  A hallway leads to the east where
one can rent a room if they need to take a rest from the rigors of a life of
adventuring.  The hallway is closed off by a small steel gate that is 
periodically opened for adventurers wishing a rest.  Next to the hall is a
small counter with a sign sitting on it.
   A fireplace with a cozy little fire is set in the northern wall offering
heat as well as light. The stairs leading up to the third floor will take
you to the extended stay area of the inn.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Grunting Boar Inn
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Should you tire of adventure or seek a peaceful nights rest, the Grunting
Boar Inn is willing to accommodate any traveler that carry enough gold.  The
dimly lit foyer has a slight musty odor, possibly coming from various trophy
animals mounted high above the walls.  A cozy arrangement of overstuffed couches
sit next to a blazing fire offering an inviting place to rest.  A simple set of
stairs leads upwards to the Reception Desk, while to the east can be heard the
sounds of bar patrons enjoying fine drink and good company.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Grand Gates of the Temple of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the base of the huge mound upon which the Temple of Midgaard
is built within the Grand Gates of the Temple.  The gates are gargantuan in
size and are made of solid gold with ancient designs of Gods, Giants, Warriors,
and peasants.
   Steps hewn from huge marble blocks lead the way up the mound to the actual
temple itself while south beyond the gates is what is commonly known as the
Temple Square.
   Braziers of eternal flame built upon the posts of the foundation of the
temple wall brightly light up the sky, even in the day.

n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Temple of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Entering the great halls of the Temple of Midgaard is awe-inspiring, as you
stand at an ornate entryway spanning nearly thirty feet across.  Huge copper
braziers at each temple corner bathes the cool, marble walls in a fiery glow.  
Elaborate tapestries bearing the crests and symbols of nobles who helped
established the Temple long ago hang gracefully from the walls and ceilings.  A
set of large stone steps inside the temple lead up to an altar dedicated to the
heroes and patrons of this age.  The entire temple is elevated prominently above
all the other buildings of Midgaard, reinforcing its position as the pinnacle
landmark within the city.

look nodri
   The white bearded wizard greets you with a smile and a nod.  He is an
honorary resident of Midgaard and knows the ins and outs of this place more than
anyone living.  He delights the children, and those who will listen, on one of
his many adventures, and there are many.  His primary purpose now is to welcome
and provide assistance to the new adventurers who arrive in Midgaard, seeking to
create a name for themselves.  If you are new to Midgaard, ask Nodri for HELP.
Nodri appears to be a male Human.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Temple of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Entering the great halls of the Temple of Midgaard is awe-inspiring, as you
stand at an ornate entryway spanning nearly thirty feet across.  Huge copper
braziers at each temple corner bathes the cool, marble walls in a fiery glow.  
Elaborate tapestries bearing the crests and symbols of nobles who helped
established the Temple long ago hang gracefully from the walls and ceilings.  A
set of large stone steps inside the temple lead up to an altar dedicated to the
heroes and patrons of this age.  The entire temple is elevated prominently above
all the other buildings of Midgaard, reinforcing its position as the pinnacle
landmark within the city.

w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Midgaard Clan Hall
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   This section of the temple complex has been prepared to oversee the many
clans of the realm.  Here adventurers can come to create, build, and manage
their clan.  Behind the stone counter towards the rear of the room is a rather
large man who seems to be scribbling away in his book.  No one knows his real
name or even where he is from but around here he is known at the Vanguard.  
Sitting beneath an open domed cella allows for light from the outside world to
illuminate the room during the day.  A portico to the east leads back to the
Temple of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">read sign
The sign reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy # - Buy an item. (Example - Buy 1 to buy the clan token)
  Reach out to an IMP to redeem the token.
  HELP CLAN for more information.
  NOTE: You MUST Buy a clan creation token first to create a clan.
  You MUST buy a clan hall token second to create your clan hall.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">296M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">134V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">290536X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0">

              Available Clan Items

5. Clan chest token               10000 resources

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">296M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">134V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">290536X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
look vanguard
   He towers over you with a calm but stern look in his eyes.  Proud to serve
Midgaard as the manager of all of the clans within the realm.  He scribbles away
inside a large book, that appears to be a ledger.  It contains the names of all
of the known clans, their roster, even the amount of gold they have in their
clan bank.  
The Vanguard appears to be a male Human.
The Vanguard is in excellent condition.

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Temple of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Entering the great halls of the Temple of Midgaard is awe-inspiring, as you
stand at an ornate entryway spanning nearly thirty feet across.  Huge copper
braziers at each temple corner bathes the cool, marble walls in a fiery glow.  
Elaborate tapestries bearing the crests and symbols of nobles who helped
established the Temple long ago hang gracefully from the walls and ceilings.  A
set of large stone steps inside the temple lead up to an altar dedicated to the
heroes and patrons of this age.  The entire temple is elevated prominently above
all the other buildings of Midgaard, reinforcing its position as the pinnacle
landmark within the city.  
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: n e s w d ]
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">scan
time
exits
who -z
</font><font color="#0080FF">Found exits: n, e, s, w, d
</font><font color="#008000">A large welcome sign hangs before the archway that leads into the city. Perhaps
 you should read it.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Grand Gates of the Temple of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the base of the huge mound upon which the Temple of Midgaard
is built within the Grand Gates of the Temple.  The gates are gargantuan in
size and are made of solid gold with ancient designs of Gods, Giants, Warriors,
and peasants.
   Steps hewn from huge marble blocks lead the way up the mound to the actual
temple itself while south beyond the gates is what is commonly known as the
Temple Square.
   Braziers of eternal flame built upon the posts of the foundation of the
temple wall brightly light up the sky, even in the day.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Market Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing on the Market Square, the famous Square of Midgaard.  It is
said that the North, East, South, and West all meet here.  This square is the
busiest in the realms for Midgaard is the center of the known civilization.  
People from all lands can be found wandering here.  At the four corners can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.  
   A large fountain of an angel pouring water stands in the center of the
square.  Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to
the bazaar, east and west bound is the main street.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street East
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the west is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
 beacon
guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. North of you the Midgaard
 Jewelers is
open to everyone at all times. Travelers can continue east towards the gates of
Midgaard by following the well lit path of magical lanterns.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the west is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
 beacon
guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. North of you the Midgaard
 Jewelers is
open to everyone at all times. Travelers can continue east towards the gates of
Midgaard by following the well lit path of magical lanterns.

armored warriors engaged in the rugged training needed to become a fighter.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street East
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   North of here is the Pawn Shop, a large sign hangs above the doorway of the
shop. The road south leads to a small circular arena where you spot several
armored warriors engaged in the rugged training needed to become a fighter.
Just to the east is the East Gate of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Entrance Hall to the Guild of Swordsmen
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself in the entrance hall of the Guild of Swordsmen.  Suits
of armor with halberds pointed towards the arched ceiling line the walls.  
This is a place where one has to be careful not to say something wrong (or
right) for tempers are quite to flare here in times of peace and prosperity.
Huge chandeliers hang down from the ceiling that causes a scintillating effect
against all the polished suits of armor.
   The hall leads further south into the guild.

n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street East
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   North of here is the Pawn Shop, a large sign hangs above the doorway of the
shop. The road south leads to a small circular arena where you spot several
armored warriors engaged in the rugged training needed to become a fighter.
Just to the east is the East Gate of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Buster's Pawn Shop
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Items of all shapes and sizes used in all walks of life are both sold and
purchased here.  Should the need arise to free yourself of an item either valued
or of little worth, the pawn broker here can almost always find a good home for
it.  Common sense would lead you to believe that few would be willing to part
with their hard earned goods, but judging by the enormous amount of items here
you know that not to be so.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street East
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   North of here is the Pawn Shop, a large sign hangs above the doorway of the
shop. The road south leads to a small circular arena where you spot several
armored warriors engaged in the rugged training needed to become a fighter.
Just to the east is the East Gate of Midgaard.

e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the west, the Midgaard Bank can be found
to the north. Directly south is a large, magical spire while the road to the
 east leads
out of Midgaard and towards a towering forest.

matching trousers.  You notice his expensive leather shoes are polished to a
shine, as he checks his stylish watch on a chain every few minutes.  Maybe it's
a byproduct of his job, but you swear this guy smells oddly like money.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the west, the Midgaard Bank can be found
to the north. Directly south is a large, magical spire while the road to the
 east leads
out of Midgaard and towards a towering forest.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the west, the Midgaard Bank can be found
to the north. Directly south is a large, magical spire while the road to the
 east leads
out of Midgaard and towards a towering forest.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">At the Bottom of the Great Spire
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The arched entrance to the spire opens up to you from the street to the east.
Large enough to accommodate a young dragon if needed its cold grey stones stand
strong, remnants of an age long gone.  The Great Spire has stood watch over the
city for aeons, its polished white stones taken from a distant land at the end
of the Great War.  A solid wooden staircase leads up to the top of the spire,
the spindles that connect the rails to the floor all appear to be hand carved
from a single great tree.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Mage's Guild
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Although no visible source of light can be found, a strange magical glow
envelops you and everything in the chamber.  At first glance you see and hear no
one, a second look reveals a man lost in thought gazing into a glowing orb of
light.  He is clad in full mage's regalia of the highest order but more
noticeable are his unblinking eyes which look remarkably similar to the ones
that watched you from the entrance to the south.  Scattered around the room on
wooden tables are many tomes, potions, and foreign objects.  He is obviously a
man of great power and knowledge.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">At the Bottom of the Great Spire
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The arched entrance to the spire opens up to you from the street to the east.
Large enough to accommodate a young dragon if needed its cold grey stones stand
strong, remnants of an age long gone.  The Great Spire has stood watch over the
city for aeons, its polished white stones taken from a distant land at the end
of the Great War.  A solid wooden staircase leads up to the top of the spire,
the spindles that connect the rails to the floor all appear to be hand carved
from a single great tree.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the East Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the west, the Midgaard Bank can be found
to the north. Directly south is a large, magical spire while the road to the
 east leads
out of Midgaard and towards a towering forest.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street East
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   North of here is the Pawn Shop, a large sign hangs above the doorway of the
shop. The road south leads to a small circular arena where you spot several
armored warriors engaged in the rugged training needed to become a fighter.
Just to the east is the East Gate of Midgaard.

busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the west is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
 beacon
guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. North of you the Midgaard
 Jewelers is
open to everyone at all times. Travelers can continue east towards the gates of
Midgaard by following the well lit path of magical lanterns.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Market Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing on the Market Square, the famous Square of Midgaard.  It is
said that the North, East, South, and West all meet here.  This square is the
busiest in the realms for Midgaard is the center of the known civilization.  
People from all lands can be found wandering here.  At the four corners can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.  
   A large fountain of an angel pouring water stands in the center of the
square.  Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to
the bazaar, east and west bound is the main street.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">look fountain
   It is a well crafted fountain, carved from a single piece of very beautiful
white marble shot through with electric blue streaks that look almost like
lightning dancing along the sides of the fountain.  It seems to be enchanted in
some manner, as the water level seems to never lower.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street West
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">  You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the east is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
beacon guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. To the north is the busy
General Store while south of here is the local Armory. Travelers heading west
 on 
Main Street will eventually find themselves at the western gates of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The General Store
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The store shelves are stocked with basic everyday supplies, from food and
water to light adventuring gear and clothing.  Occasionally you might find rare
and expensive items up for sale, though not for long as they usually sell out
quickly.  Stopping by the general store on a regular basis to stock up on
supplies would be a really smart.  
A small note hangs on the wall.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">look grocer
The grocer is round and portly, the exact stereotype of what a grocer might look
like.  He has on an apron which is stained with various unidentified foodstuffs.
What he's selling might not exactly be high end, but at least it's relatively
affordable.  
The Grocer appears to be a male Human.
The Grocer is in excellent condition.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">256M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">133V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">290536X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
read note
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street West
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">  You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the east is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
beacon guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. To the north is the busy
General Store while south of here is the local Armory. Travelers heading west
 on 
Main Street will eventually find themselves at the western gates of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Armory
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   There are rows of all armor types lined up along the display cases, along
with bright shields of all sizes hanging from the walls.  Any equipment
purchased here can always be serviced or repaired for a nominal fee.  At the
back of the shop is a door which leads to the armorer's furnace, where rhythmic
sound of hammers falling on anvils can be heard.
     A finely crafted sign made of polished bronze hangs above the counter.

look armorer
A thin man of average build, the merchant offers you a wide selection of armor
available in stock.  His groomed appearance and pale hands indicate his
expertise is in running a shop, not a furnace.  The high quality armor displayed
about the store must be crafted by someone else, a master armorer most likely.
The Armorer appears to be a male Human.
The Armorer is in excellent condition.

+-------------------------------------------------------+
&quot;|              - The Midgaard Armory -                  &quot;|
&quot;|                 Hours  7am to 7pm                     &quot;|
&quot;|                                                       &quot;|
&quot;|  Equipment repair costs vary by item, see service     &quot;|
&quot;|   for an estimate. We will purchase your old          &quot;|
&quot;|  and used armor in any condition, make us an offer!   &quot;|
+-------------------------------------------------------+

You can use these commands for trading:
  value &lt;item&gt;     To get the price of an item in your possession.
  sell &lt;item&gt;      To sell something.
  buy &lt;item&gt;       To buy something (provided that the shop has it in store).
  list             Gives you a listing of the shop's inventory.

        WE DON'T GIVE CREDIT; WE DON'T EXPECT TO RECEIVE CREDIT!
                             NO HAGGLING

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Weapon Shop
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself inside a weapon shop.  Hanging off the walls are various
implements of death and destruction.  The more valuable weapons can be found
behind a counter.  There is a small note on the counter.
   It feels a bit eerie in here due to the light produced from the glowing
weapons under the counter.

look weaponsmith
The apprentice weaponsmith is a fresh faced youth, his wiry frame just beginning
to pack on muscles from the rigors of running the forge.  Although he seems
young, he must be quite dependable since his master entrusts him with running
the store in his absence.  Taking in the easy and confident manner in which the
apprentice weaponsmith handles the sharp weapons, you can tell he is as skilled
in using weapons as he is in making them.  

The apprentice Weaponsmith appears to be a male Human.
The apprentice Weaponsmith is in excellent condition.

read note
The note reads:

  List  - Show which various items are in the store.
  Buy   - Buy an item.
  Value - The shopkeeper will (free of charge) tell how much he will
          pay for your item.
  Sell  - Sell an item.

n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street West
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   The Main Street continues eastwards towards the Market Square and just
west of here are the iron gates of Midgaard. To the south you make out
the distinct sounds of weapons being forged by a blacksmith, while just 
north of where you stand is a well known magic shop.
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: n e s w ]

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street West
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">  You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   To the east is a beautiful fountain of an angel which is like a shining
beacon guiding all to the Market Square of Midgaard. To the north is the busy
General Store while south of here is the local Armory. Travelers heading west
 on 
Main Street will eventually find themselves at the western gates of Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Magic Shop
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Stepping inside the Magic Shop is like crossing the boundaries of an optical
illusion, as the immediate impression is the interior of the shop is many times
larger than the outside might suggest.  No doubt powerful magical spells are
being used effectively to provide the real estate, as rows and rows of various
items are stacked haphazardly in shelves as far as the eye can see.  Potions,
scrolls, and various odds and ends that are used for magical arts are available
for sale here.  Anyone even thinking of shoplifting might be forewarned, the
shop items are guarded with deadly protective runes that have disabled many a
would-be thief.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Main Street West
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on the Main Street in the City of Midgaard.  This street is the
busiest in all the known realms for Midgaard is the central trade city.  People
from all civilizations can be seen wandering the streets, stocking up on
supplies, and bartering with one another.  Day or night the stores here are
always open, truly the city that never sleeps.
   The Main Street continues eastwards towards the Market Square and just
west of here are the iron gates of Midgaard. To the south you make out
the distinct sounds of weapons being forged by a blacksmith, while just 
north of where you stand is a well known magic shop.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the east, Wall Road begins to the south, and to
the north a small dirt path runs along the side of the wall.  As far as
beyond the gate, gently rolling hills converge with river and forest.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A Dirt Path
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Along the inner side of the eastern city wall is a seldom traveled dirt path,
nestled among a grove of young oak trees.  The trail winds around low shrubbery
and hedgerows making it difficult to follow.  The faint sound of rustling leaves
can be heard as a cool breezes dances lightly through the trees, otherwise the
surroundings are stangely silent.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A Bend in the Path
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The dimly lit path here takes a slight detour northwards following the city
wall, where stately older trees have grown to towering heights.  This part of
Midgaard was kept pristine, with little development work done throughout the of
Migdaard devoted to following nature's path.  Years.  Consequently it has become
a haven and place of gathering for the guilds of Migdaard devoted to following
nature's path.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Before the Hidden Grove
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You wander around, slightly lost by now.  The forest growth seems to stretch
in all directions, especially towards the west.  Glancing around, you notice a
peculiar arrangement of stones to the east that is arranged in a rough circular
shape with a small monolith placed in the center.  On a tree to the north and
almost concealed by leaves, you spot two small arrows embedded high among the
direction that came from.  Branches.  For a second you think you heard a voice,
but it's hard to tell which direction that came from.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The dimly lit path here takes a slight detour northwards following the city
wall, where stately older trees have grown to towering heights.  This part of

Migdaard devoted to following nature's path.  Years.  Consequently it has become
a haven and place of gathering for the guilds of Migdaard devoted to following
nature's path.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A Dirt Path
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Along the inner side of the eastern city wall is a seldom traveled dirt path,
nestled among a grove of young oak trees.  The trail winds around low shrubbery
and hedgerows making it difficult to follow.  The faint sound of rustling leaves
can be heard as a cool breezes dances lightly through the trees, otherwise the
surroundings are stangely silent.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the east, Wall Road begins to the south, and to
the north a small dirt path runs along the side of the wall.  As far as
beyond the gate, gently rolling hills converge with river and forest.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Inside the West Gate of Midgaard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are by two large towers that have been built into the city wall.  
Connecting the towers high up in the air is a narrow walkway that the guards use
to cross from one tower to the next.  Between the towers is a heavy iron gate
that is used to keep the enemies of Midgaard out.  Along the top of the towers,
huge magical fires burn providing a bright light even on the darkest of the
nights.
   Main Street begins to the east, Wall Road begins to the south, and to
the north a small dirt path runs along the side of the wall.  As far as
beyond the gate, gently rolling hills converge with river and forest.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern end of Wall Road.  Farther to north you can see the
Western Gate of Midgaard.  The street is quite busy for it is a popular route
taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the tall city wall
that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is quite easy to
figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the street can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that
glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues south towards
Southern Midgaard.

s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs north-south through western Midgaard.  The 
street is quite busy for it is a popular route taken by travellers to enter 
the Southern Midgaard.  From the tall city wall that runs parallel to the road
along its western edge, it is quite easy to figure out where the name for this
street came from.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical 
lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that glow with a bright light when
it gets dark.  The street continues north towards the Western Gate and south 
towards Southern Midgaard.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs north-south through western Midgaard.  The 
street is quite busy for it is a popular route taken by travellers to enter 
the Southern Midgaard.  From the tall city wall that runs parallel to the road
along its western edge, it is quite easy to figure out where the name for this
street came from.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical 
lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that glow with a bright light when
it gets dark.  The wall continues north towards the Western Gate and south 
towards Southern Midgaard.  A small, poor alley leads off to the east.
   Some letters have been written on the wall here.

e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Western End of Poor Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the western end of a small alley connecting the Common Square
to the Wall Road.  The buildings are built close along the road making the
alley indeed narrow.  As with most alleys, the poor and the homeless have
collected here.
   A foul stench permeates from the south. The alley continues to the east 
and ends at Wall Road to the west.

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Dump
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself in the dump with garbage up to your knees.  This is where
all the people of Midgaard drop their garbage.  Looking across the huge mound,
you see the Candlebriar River, which must be where all this garbage eventually
ends up.  You can't say for sure how long this garbage has been here, but it
gives off a puke green light that softly illuminates the area, even during the
day.
   The dump exits north back to the alley.  After some searching through
the garbage, you can see a large junction of pipes which looks like the
entrance to the sewers under Midgaard.
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: n ]

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Entrance to the Midgaard Sewers
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are directly under the City of Midgaard.  A ladder here, secured against
the wall leads up to a hatch.  The stench is almost unbearable.  The slimy,
filthy walls surround you on all sides but south, which leads into miles of
darkened tunnel.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">u
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Dump
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself in the dump with garbage up to your knees.  This is where
all the people of Midgaard drop their garbage.  Looking across the huge mound,
you see the Candlebriar River, which must be where all this garbage eventually
ends up.  You can't say for sure how long this garbage has been here, but it
gives off a puke green light that softly illuminates the area, even during the
day.
   The dump exits north back to the alley.  After some searching through
the garbage, you can see a large junction of pipes which looks like the
entrance to the sewers under Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Western End of Poor Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the western end of a small alley connecting the Common Square
to the Wall Road.  The buildings are built close along the road making the
alley indeed narrow.  As with most alleys, the poor and the homeless have
collected here.
   A foul stench permeates from the south. The alley continues to the east 
and ends at Wall Road to the west.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Common Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are in the common square of Midgaard.  The sound of merchants can be
heard off to the north as they chant their goods for sale.  People full of
chatter pass you by as they enter or leave the bazaar.  To the east and west,
alleys lead to shadier side of Midgaard.  At the corners of the square can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that
glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  South leads across the bridge to
Southern Midgaard.

n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Southern Bazaar
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Merchant selling chants echo above the excited buzz of buyers.  Here, all 
kinds of goods can be purchased and sold for profit and never the same thing 
two days in a row.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical 
lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that glow with a bright light 
when it gets dark.  The bazaar continues to the north and the Common Square 
can be seen to the south.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Market Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing on the Market Square, the famous Square of Midgaard.  It is
said that the North, East, South, and West all meet here.  This square is the
busiest in the realms for Midgaard is the center of the known civilization.  
People from all lands can be found wandering here.  At the four corners can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.  
   A large fountain of an angel pouring water stands in the center of the
square.  Roads lead in every direction, north to the temple square, south to
the bazaar, east and west bound is the main street.

look guard
At first glance, he seems like an ordinary cityguard, but more...alert.  His
movements are calculated and precise, making almost no noise as he keeps silent
watch over the city at night.  A small insignia on his visor crest signifies he
is a member of the Elite order of Cityguards.

The Elite Cityguard appears to be a male Human.
The Elite Cityguard is in excellent condition.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Southern Bazaar
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Merchant selling chants echo above the excited buzz of buyers.  Here, all 
kinds of goods can be purchased and sold for profit and never the same thing 
two days in a row.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical 
lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that glow with a bright light 
when it gets dark.  The bazaar continues to the north and the Common Square 
can be seen to the south.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Common Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are in the common square of Midgaard.  The sound of merchants can be
heard off to the north as they chant their goods for sale.  People full of
chatter pass you by as they enter or leave the bazaar.  To the east and west,
alleys lead to shadier side of Midgaard.  At the corners of the square can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that
glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  South leads across the bridge to
Southern Midgaard.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Western End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the western end of a dark alley that winds east towards
the walls of Midgaard.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the
 buildings
are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but it also 
gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   The back of the Guild of Swordsmen can be seen to the north while south of
here is the highly unpopular Thieves' Guild.  The alley continues east and exits
at the Common Square to the West.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Entrance Hall to the Guild of Thieves
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself in the dim hall of the Thieves' Guild.  Glancing nervously
about the room, it appears as if it is completely empty of life but the strange
sensation of hair standing on the back of your neck can be felt for in these
halls can be found the most promising thieves in Midgaard.
   The entrance hall exits to the north to the dark alley and heads deeper into
the guild to the east.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Western End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the western end of a dark alley that winds east towards
the walls of Midgaard.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the
 buildings
are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but it also 
gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   The back of the Guild of Swordsmen can be seen to the north while south of
here is the highly unpopular Thieves' Guild.  The alley continues east and exits
at the Common Square to the West.

e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing in a dark alley that runs east and west.  This alley does 
not only gets its name from how the buildings are cropped so close to the alley
so that most light is blocked, but it also gets its name from the fact that the
shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   To the south lies a huge warehouse filled with boats of all different shapes
 and sizes. 
The warehouse extends out towards the levee leading to the river.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Eastern End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the eastern end of a dark alley that winds west towards
the Common Square.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the 
buildings are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but
it also gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be
found here.
   The alley ends here with the large wall that surrounds Midgaard. To the
 north you 
hear battle shouts and fighting while to the south, a strange green glow emits
 from darkness.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Battle Arena
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The smell of blood and sweat permeates the battlegrounds here.  You are
nearly deafened by the shouts of the many people positioned around the battle
arena that is centered in the middle of this hall.  Some are shouting victory
for the champion they placed their bets on while others are crying in disbelief.
The battle arena itself has two strong berserker fighters facing off in an epic
battle for dominance.  The east leads to the training quarters for these strong
and fierce warriors.

s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Eastern End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the eastern end of a dark alley that winds west towards
the Common Square.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the 
buildings are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but
it also gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be
found here.
   The alley ends here with the large wall that surrounds Midgaard. To the
 north you 
hear battle shouts and fighting while to the south, a strange green glow emits
 from darkness.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Entrance to the Warlock's Guild
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Intricate sketchings of the different phases of the moon scatter along the
dark hall.  Shadowy, cloaked figures sit in various corners studying from their
black books of magic.  You watch in horror as one student reaches out with a
bony hand, green flashes fly from his fingertips, sucking the life out of a
large rat that was scampering from a hole in the wall.  It makes a loud squeak
then silence as it's soul is consumed by the figure.  To the south, the hall
continues deeper into the guild.

n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Eastern End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the eastern end of a dark alley that winds west towards
the Common Square.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the 
buildings are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but
it also gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be
found here.
   The alley ends here with the large wall that surrounds Midgaard. To the
 north you 
hear battle shouts and fighting while to the south, a strange green glow emits
 from darkness.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing in a dark alley that runs east and west.  This alley does 
not only gets its name from how the buildings are cropped so close to the alley
so that most light is blocked, but it also gets its name from the fact that the
shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   To the south lies a huge warehouse filled with boats of all different shapes
 and sizes. 
The warehouse extends out towards the levee leading to the river.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Warehouse
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are inside a huge warehouse.  There are stacks of lumber and ore piled
 up to 
the roof against the western wall while east of that are various boats that are
currently being built.  The walls of the warehouse is decorated with various
items from ships.  The room is brightly illuminated from lanterns hanging from
the ceiling.
The warehouse exits to the north and south.

   After a lifetime of loyal service to the emperor, Captain Weilyn was given a
writ of retirement to return home in peace.  He now passes his time by selling
simple, seafaring vessels to would be travelers seeking adventure upon the open
waters.  
The Ferryman appears to be a male Human.
The Ferryman is in excellent condition.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">s
</font><font color="#00FFFF">On the River
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The levee to the north forms a sturdy bulwark against the river, ensuring the
citizens, shopkeepers, and adventurers in Midgaard are safe from the perils of a
flood.  Rapidly swirling eddies can be observed directly to the west where the
river bottom dips and swimming becomes impossible.  You can continue to the east
along the shallows of the river, but traveling west would be impossible without
a boat.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">On the River
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The levee to the north forms a sturdy bulwark against the river, ensuring the
citizens, shopkeepers, and adventurers in Midgaard are safe from the perils of a
flood.  Rapidly swirling eddies can be observed directly to the west where the
river bottom dips and swimming becomes impossible.  You can continue to the east
along the shallows of the river, but traveling west would be impossible without
a boat.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">On the Swift Flowing River
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">  The river flows quickly here as it leaves Midgaard behind to the east.
Off the north bank the trees of Haon-Dor tower above you, casting their long
shadows across the water. A bridge disappears in the distance behind you as
another one approaches ahead. To the south a rapid section of the river
branches off.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">On the River
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The levee to the north forms a sturdy bulwark against the river, ensuring the
citizens, shopkeepers, and adventurers in Midgaard are safe from the perils of a
flood.  Rapidly swirling eddies can be observed directly to the west where the
river bottom dips and swimming becomes impossible.  You can continue to the east
along the shallows of the river, but traveling west would be impossible without
a boat.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Levee
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the levee.  The ground beneath your feet is moist from the river
that is gently flowing west to the south of here.  The river back is very low
making it possible to enter the river.  Tied to stakes on the river banks are
various fishing boats used for navigating the river.
   A warehouse can be seen to the north.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Warehouse
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are inside a huge warehouse.  There are stacks of lumber and ore piled
 up to

currently being built.  The walls of the warehouse is decorated with various
items from ships.  The room is brightly illuminated from lanterns hanging from
the ceiling.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing in a dark alley that runs east and west.  This alley does 
not only gets its name from how the buildings are cropped so close to the alley
so that most light is blocked, but it also gets its name from the fact that the
shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   To the south lies a huge warehouse filled with boats of all different shapes
 and sizes. 
The warehouse extends out towards the levee leading to the river.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">131M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">131V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">290536X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Western End of Dark Alley
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself at the western end of a dark alley that winds east towards
the walls of Midgaard.  This alley does not only gets its name from how the
 buildings
are cropped so close to the alley so that most light is blocked, but it also 
gets its name from the fact that the shadier side of Midgaard can be found here.
   The back of the Guild of Swordsmen can be seen to the north while south of
here is the highly unpopular Thieves' Guild.  The alley continues east and exits
at the Common Square to the West.
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: e s w ]
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">scan
time
exits
who -z

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Common Square
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are in the common square of Midgaard.  The sound of merchants can be
heard off to the north as they chant their goods for sale.  People full of
chatter pass you by as they enter or leave the bazaar.  To the east and west,
alleys lead to shadier side of Midgaard.  At the corners of the square can be
found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the sorcerer's guild, that
glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  South leads across the bridge to
Southern Midgaard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Midgaard Bridge
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are standing on a stone bridge crossing the Candlebriar River that
separates Northern and Southern Midgaard.  The bridge is built out from the city
walls and the river flows west and east through an opening ten feet below the
bridge.  Along the length of the bridge can be found tall poles with magical
lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Bridge Intersection
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern area of Southern Midgaard, or as some call
it -- New and Improved Midgaard.  Quaint houses with white picket fences
next to small cozy shops abound in this area.  Obviously from the looks of the
area, the more well to do live in this area.  Along the street can be found 
tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.
   The street leads off east and west to an extension of Wall Road.  
The Midgaard Bridge leading to Northern Midgaard is just north of here.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Cathedral Atrium
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The entrance into the Cathedral of Roses is a long hallway running east-west
with high pointed arches raises several sword lengths over your head.  Lining
the walls are full suits of plate armor with a rosey sheen from the light
filtering from above through rose colored quartz.  High above and behind the
armor are tapestries with the images of knights in battle rallying around a
translucent rose as their foes rush forward to their deaths.  Two large but
modest doors lead to the Cathedral Sanctuary to the west while east leads back
out to Emerald Avenue.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Emerald Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself walking along a nice cobblestone road.  Peculiar trees
planted along the edge of the road in rows give this avenue its name for when it
starts to get dark, the trunks of the trees grow with an eerie green light.  
The avenue continues to the north and ends at Wall Road to the south while west
leads to the Paladin's Guild.

The Elite Cityguard arrives from the south.
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">86M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">132V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">290536X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the north lies Royal Boulevard and to the south a small exit
in the wall leads to Midgaard's graveyard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Before the Black Altar
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   This crypt is covered in blackness and filth.  Cobwebs litter all corners of
this area.  It looks like this place was once a church but it has been twisted
and torn apart by rot, now serving as the resting place for the damned.  At the
back of the crypt, to the east, is a large black altar.  A large archway also
extends towards a dark, mysterious room to the north.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the north lies Royal Boulevard and to the south a small exit
in the wall leads to Midgaard's graveyard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Royal Boulevard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
   The boulevard continues to the north and the south.

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Sacred Garden
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself standing in a small enclosed area that is totally foreign
to what is normally found in Midgaard.  An outcropping of rock has been placed
in the northwestern corner of the garden with a waterfall running down the 
sides that builds a tiny stream that disappears to the south.  Along the sides
of the stream are miniature trees carefully pruned.  What is most strange about
the area is the miniature village and array of tiny figures with banners the
colors of the rainbow.  They seem to be arranged as if going to battle.
   To the south of the garden is a strange many tiered building made of wood.
There are sliding doors with panels that lets the light shine through as if it
was made of paper.  The busy Royal Boulevard is just to the west but that seems
miles and miles away.
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: s w ]
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">scan

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Royal Boulevard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
  The boulevard continues to the north and
the south.  To the east is the entrance to the Samurai Guild.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Royal Boulevard and Central Street
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
   The boulevard continues to the north and the south.  Directly east of here is
the not very large City Hall of Midgaard while to the west leads to Central
 Street.

e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Pathway to the Monastery
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Stone steps wind their way up a small hill towards a very ancient temple.  
You feel nothing but peace, tranquility and a perfect sense of balance here.  
The pathway is littered with statues and foreign symbols, none of which you
recognize.  You can't see much within the temple from here but you can hear
sounds of Monks training for combat, harnessing their Chi.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Royal Boulevard
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
   The boulevard continues to the north and the south.  Directly east of here is
the path of enlightenment leading towards the Monk's Guild.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the south lies Royal Boulevard.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the south lies a strange looking store.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Sage's Domain
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The walls of this shop are covered with shelves filled with books of all
sorts.  In the center of the shop are several comfortable chairs facing the
sage's desk, which is up against the far wall.  Amongst the various books,
parchments, and scrolls on the sage's desk, you see a shimmering crystal ball
prominently displayed.  The only exit you see is to the north.

is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the south lies Wizdale Avenue.  
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: e s w ]

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Bridge Intersection
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern area of Southern Midgaard, or as some call
it -- New and Improved Midgaard.  Quaint houses with white picket fences
next to small cozy shops abound in this area.  Obviously from the looks of the
area, the more well to do live in this area.  Along the street can be found 
tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.
   The street leads off east and west to an extension of Wall Road.  
The Midgaard Bridge leading to Northern Midgaard is just north of here.

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">n
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  South leads to Emerald Avenue.  
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: e s ]

time

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">e
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Bridge Intersection
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are at the northern area of Southern Midgaard, or as some call
it -- New and Improved Midgaard.  Quaint houses with white picket fences
next to small cozy shops abound in this area.  Obviously from the looks of the
area, the more well to do live in this area.  Along the street can be found 
tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow
with a bright light when it gets dark.
   The street leads off east and west to an extension of Wall Road.  
The Midgaard Bridge leading to Northern Midgaard is just north of here.
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: n e w ]

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wall Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on wall road that runs east-west of Southern Midgaard.  The wall
itself runs the entire perimeter of the City.  The street is quite busy for it
is a popular route taken by travelers to enter the Southern Midgaard.  From the
tall city wall that runs parallel to the road along its western edge, it is
quite easy to figure out where the name for this street came from.  Along the
street can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's
Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.  The street continues
east and west.  To the south lies Wizdale Avenue.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wizdale Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy avenue.  Shops and homes can be seen on the each
side of the street.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical
lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.  
   The avenue continues to the north and ends to the south and the Grand
 Playhouse can be found to the east.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Grand Playhouse
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are in a magnificent theater.  The theater spreads out to the south of
you from the entrance at the north.  Wooden benches line the floor to the foot
of the stage while on the east and west walls are balconies for the more
prestigious.  Magnificent chandeliers hanging from the high frescoed painted
ceiling shines with a radiance that makes one gasp with the sight of such
beauty.
   This building is also the guild house of the Society of Joyous and Sorrowful
Comedians, Rapturous Play Actors, Graceful Dancers, and Melodious Songsters
 which
can be found south beyond the stage.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Central Street and Wizdale Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy avenue.  Shops and homes can be seen on the each
side of the street.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical
lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.
   The intersection continues south on Wizdale and runs east and west on
 Central Street.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the western corner of the Central Street.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
   The street continues to the east while to the west is Emerald Avenue.
To the north lies a dirt path that ventures off into a small, wooded area.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the western corner of the Central Street.  The

of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Emerald Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself walking along a nice cobblestone road.  Peculiar trees
planted along the edge of the road in rows give this avenue its name for when it
starts to get dark, the trunks of the trees grow with an eerie green light.  
The avenue continues to the north and south while east leads to Central Street.
   The avenue continues to the north and south while east leads to Central
 Street.

Training Grounds.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Central Street and Wizdale Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy avenue.  Shops and homes can be seen on the each
side of the street.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical
lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.
   The intersection continues south on Wizdale and runs east and west on
 Central Street.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Royal Boulevard and Central Street
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The
cobblestones are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone,
you can tell that they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years
of feet treading will smooth the marble to a glossy shine.
   The boulevard continues to the north and the south.  Directly east of here is
the not very large City Hall of Midgaard while to the west leads to Central
 Street.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Central Street and Wizdale Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy avenue.  Shops and homes can be seen on the each
side of the street.  Along the street can be found tall poles with magical
lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.
   The intersection continues south on Wizdale and runs east and west on
 Central Street.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wizdale Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy avenue.  Shops and homes can be seen on the each

lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it
gets dark.  The avenue continues to the north and ends to the south at the
intersection of Park Road.  To the east lies the Temple of Opulence.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Park benches litter this road on either side.  The days of the serene
tranquility have been left behind long ago with the growth of Southern Midgaard.
The road is filled with tourists, citizens, and merchants trying to sell their
goods to anybody within earshot.  In all this clamor, you still sense a feeling
of peacefulness coming from the grove to the south.  Along the road can be found
tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a
bright light when it gets dark.

</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">w
</font><font color="#00FFFF">Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Park benches litter this road on either side.  The days of the serene
tranquility have been left behind long ago with the growth of Southern Midgaard.
The road is filled with tourists, citizens, and merchants trying to sell their
goods to anybody within earshot.  In all this clamor, you still sense a feeling
of peacefulness coming from the grove to the south.  Along the road can be found
tall poles with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a
bright light when it gets dark.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Emerald Avenue
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You find yourself walking along a nice cobblestone road.  Peculiar trees
planted along the edge of the road in rows give this avenue its name for when it
starts to get dark, the trunks of the trees grow with an eerie green light.  
The avenue continues to the north and south while east leads to Park Road.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Wizdale Avenue and Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy area.  Along the street can be found tall poles
with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright
light when it gets dark.  The avenue stretches to your north while Park Road
extends east and west.  A well trodden dirt path leads southwards towards the
Emerald Grove.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   The days of the serene tranquility have been left behind long ago with the
growth of Southern Midgaard.  The road is filled with tourists, citizens, and
merchants trying to sell their goods to anybody within earshot.  In all this
clamor, you still sense a feeling of peacefulness coming from the park to the
south.  Along the road can be found tall poles with magical lanterns, provided
by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright light when it gets dark.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Royal Boulevard and Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand at the beautiful and majestic Royal Boulevard.  The cobblestones
are of a milky-gray marble.  From the roughness of the stone, you can tell that
they were recently produced from a quarry; however, years of feet treading will
smooth the marble to a glossy shine.  The boulevard continues to the north and
the south.  To the west lies Park Road.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Intersection of Wizdale Avenue and Park Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Wisps float around on this avenue, a beautiful reminder of nature's calm even
amidst the clamor of this busy area.  Along the street can be found tall poles
with magical lanterns, provided by the Mage's Guild, that glow with a bright
light when it gets dark.  The avenue stretches to your north while Park Road
extends east and west.  A well trodden dirt path leads southwards towards the
Emerald Grove.
